intro: Corydalis squamigera, commonly known as the silverleaf corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Fumariaceae family, characterized by its delicate, often spurred flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered with a fine, silvery or grayish pubescence, giving it its common name. Corydalis squamigera produces small, nodding flowers in shades of pink, purple, or white, often blooming in late spring to early summer.
